conclusion: The problem involves determining the temperature of an ideal gas at state C using given data and the p-V diagram.
The temperature at state A is given as -73°C, which converts to 200 K.
The internal energy of the gas changes by 200 J during the process from state A to state C.
The volume at state A is 1 × 10^-3 m³, and at state C is 4 × 10^-3 m³.
The pressure at state A is 3 × 10^5 Pa, and at state C is 1 × 10^5 Pa.
The gas constant R is given as 8.31 J/(mol·K).
The process from A to B is isobaric (constant pressure) as indicated by the diagram.
Using the isobaric relation P_A V_A = P_B V_B, it is confirmed that V_B = 1 × 10^-3 m³, consistent with the diagram.
The process from B to C is isochoric (constant volume) as indicated by the diagram.
Using the isochoric relation P_B/T_B = P_C/T_C, it is derived that T_C = (1/3) T_B.
Using the ideal gas law P_A V_A / T_A = P_B V_B / T_B, it is calculated that T_B = 800 K.
Using the relation T_C = (1/3) T_B, it is calculated that T_C = 800/3 ≈ 266.67 K.
The internal energy change ΔU is verified using ΔU = n c_v ΔT, where c_v = (3/2) R and ΔT = T_C - T_A.
